intro: Begonia tumbezensis, commonly known as the Tumbes begonia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Ecuador. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and a distinctively hairy stem. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
